intro: Acrossanthes, commonly known as the star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounded by a central disk of smaller florets. Acrossanthes is often found in open fields and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
